alert.note: Alert for Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 29 at 10:18AM EDT until further notice by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Above Lake Harney affecting Seminole County. .The center of Tropical Storm Ian will emerge off of the Brevard County coast in the next hour, with historic rainfall of 12 to 18 inches reported across east central Florida. These amounts have already caused quick rises along the Saint Johns River. The forecast point above Lake Harney reached Moderate Flood Stage this morning, and is forecast to rise to Major Flood by Friday morning. A crest of 10.7 is predicted early next week, which will hold steady. Interests along the river should be prepared for major flood impacts to arrive over the next several days. For the St. Johns River...including Above Lake Harney...Major flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 245 AM EDT. && ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...St Johns River Near Above Lake Harney. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.8 feet, Water covers State Road 46 and it may become impassable near Jungle Road and Prevatt Road. Standing water on secondary roads near the river deepens to more than three feet in some areas. Flooding becomes more significant to structures and marinas from above Lake Harney to the Lake Jesup area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM EDT Thursday was 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.8 feet early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 am) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Mon Tue St Johns River Above Lake Harne 8.0 9.0 Thu 9 am 10.0 10.4 10.6 10.7 10.7 &&
